project.name: Heroes of Spin
project.description: Collaborating with 5 other developers on a new slot game and underlying framework.

project.name: (Not yet released)
project.description: Complete website build and integration with WordPress, for a startup initiative by a leading UK financial services institution

project.name: Euroconsumers graphs
project.description: SVG chart components as part of a pattern library for a European consumer organisation.

project.name: S2Bot 4 Scratch
project.description: A Chrome app to enable control of various hardware devices from MIT's popular Scratch programming software for children. It includes an HTTP server implemented in Javascript, and it can communicate with serial, Bluetooth Low Energy and USB HID devices.

project.name: PICAXE Programmer
project.description:
A Chrome App that parses a binary file and uploads data to a hardware device by implementing a serial protocol. 
Later, implemented an iOS prototype of this app in Swift that communicates via Bluetooth Low Energy protoocl

project.name: PICAXE Blockly
project.description:
Creating a visual programming editor for microcontroller kits used in education, using Google Blockly and Javascript. This is available standalone as a Chrome App, as an online service, and also integrated within a larger Windows application. 
After creating a program, a student can then test it by stepping through the commands in a simulated device before compiling it via an online cloud service, and then uploading it directly onto a real device, all from the same application

project.name: Deal or No Deal: The Bankers Riches slot game
project.description: This has proved one of Endemol's most lucrative titles. I made the Flash version, together with a couple of reskins for different international markets. A few years later, I made an equally successful HTML version, and integrated it with a couple of different game platforms.

project.name: Deal or No Deal fixed odds game
project.description: I produced both Flash and HTML clients for this game, based on the very popular TV show.

project.name: Avast ye Booty
project.description: A cute scratch game where you hunt for the pirate treasure.

project.name: Big Brother All Star Eviction Night
project.description: Bet on which housemates will win, survive or be evicted over five eviction rounds.

project.name: Battlecash Bonanza
project.description: Based on the classic pen and paper game, this game features some great visual effects

project.name: Supernova games
project.description: We created three versions of this game format: Fruity Supernova, Aliens Supernova and Star Sign Supernova.  Each featured concentric reels, 12 win lines and 3 bonus games.

project.name: Shut the Box
project.description: A version of the old pub game updated where you throw the dice to close the numbers.

project.name: Tower Power
project.description: Try and predict how high the falling dice will stack up into towers.

project.name: Baltimore Drop
project.description: An original bagatelle themed game. Bets can be placed on which pocket a ball lands in, or which pins it hits on its way down the board.

project.name: Guardian banner advert
project.description: An interactive banner and screensaver as part of a campaign for The Guardian. A bunch of algorithmic naturalistic animation.

project.name: Aztecs N' Adders
project.description: A nicely designed variant of Snakes & Ladders. The higher up the board you get, the higher the prizes.

project.name: Sanna Annukka Smith website
project.description: Working with designer Niall McCormack, we produced a website for this reknowned illustrator including a bespoke content management system, and full integration with the e-commerce package CubeCart.

project.name: Intel "Race ahead" game
project.description: A isometric 3D game for Intel, in which an IT manager moves around a course avoiding obstacles and collecting hardware components

project.name: E3 Minisite and pledge map
project.description: A Flash minisite for businesses about saving electricity, including a section in which users could make pledges and see them plotted on a map of the UK

project.name: Streetlight Banner Advert
project.description: This interactive banner was produced in the style of a game and demonstrates, using cacophonous effects, the perils of walking along streets that have poor lighting.

clientName: Office of the Deputy Prime Minister

project.name: Intel ITMG2 game
project.description: A second, expanded version of the very successful Intel IT manager game, featuring more rooms to manage, skills for the manager to attain, different company levels and love affairs in the staff cafeteria.

project.name: NSPCC TalkTown
project.description: I built the Flash front-end to a virtual town of "Linguabot chatbots" which gave advice on matters related to child welfare

project.name: Online Skills Testing
project.description: A modular and extensible Flash application to enable online testing of numerical, literacy, data entry and comprehension skills for job applicants.

project.name: Chase Me Charlie game
project.description: A Flash game to demonstrate the basics of the "Chase Me Charlie" pony riding competition

project.name: "Debating the Evidence" teaching material
project.description: An online educational resource prototype which provides a way for students to evaluate and discuss scientific hypotheses in a safe enironment.

project.name: BMI route map and editor
project.description: Dynamic map for the BMI website showing airport and route information, and a WYSIWYG map editor for BMI staff allowing them to manage the routes and their configuration.

project.name: Intel IT Manager Game
project.description: Lead Flash programmer for this realistic simulation of an IT manager's world. Finalist for a BIMA award, and nominated for 2 Yahoo Revolution awards in 2004.

project.name: 1 Pumpcourt website
project.description: I built a site for 1 Pump Court, a radical and progressive set of chambers with a focus on legally aided clients. It included a simple CMS that would allow the members to update their own profile

project.name: Flash widgets for CiTV homepage
project.description: Site navigation, video player and message ticker-tape for the Childrens ITV website homepage, made within 2 days

project.name: Sunday Times The Month CD-ROM
project.description: Working at Mook, I lead the initial technical development for The Sunday Times "The Month" - a multimedia CD-ROM, published for 18 months from September 2003. Nominated for BAFTA, Design Week and Revolution awards in 2004.

project.name: Linaker dynamic news system
project.description: News publishing system to allow in-house staff to create and edit articles

project.name: Microsoft "Get on the Net" CD-ROM
project.description: Lead developer for a rich multimedia Director based CD-ROM for Microsoft, promoting the use of Internet Explorer. Responsible for integrating the work of a team of designers and developers into a coherent application

project.name: InTouch with Health kiosk
project.description: Lead developer on the pilot version of a national networked healthcare information kiosk. Developed with Authorware, using SQL, and writing RTF output for the printed information

project.name: HSBC kiosk
project.description: Lead UI developer for this national networked kiosk, including integration with card reading, telephony and textphone functionality. Working with XML, XSL, HTML, Flash, VBScript, Javascript

project.name: Guinness G magazine
project.description: I adapted the company's in-house publishing system to generate and package an offline Flash-based publication. Using Flash, Flash Generator, ASP, XML and XSL

project.name: Guinness desktop clock and screensaver
project.description: Two web-aware desktop applications for Guinness, written with GLPro

project.name: Interactive map for the British Tourist Authority website
project.description: Lead UI developer on this pioneering use of cross-browser DHTML and AJAX (before AJAX had a name) to plot icons on top of a map layer

project.name: Circle Christmas Card
project.description: Physics based game in which you try to balance the decorations on the tree without it overbalancing

project.name: Visitbritain CD-ROM
project.description: Multilingual promotional CD-ROM for international distribution

project.name: Microsoft/Cabinet Office “I-Form” prototype
project.description: Lead UI developer for this web based application for IE4, written to showcase the capabilities of DHTML and ActiveX technologies
